name: Wingate by Wyndham Tampa / USF

reviews.text: Had a nice check in , room was clean and clod, close to the attractions! Will be back
reviews.title: Up to expectations.

reviews.text: I am here near USF for a conference and the conference recommended this hotel. While there is a good shuttle service here within a 3 mile radius, be sure to rent a car if you want to get around. There is no room service here so you will either have to use the shuttle service (eat early) or order take out. The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean. But overall the design and the feel of the experience is certainly very generic. East Fowler Ave is just a street with strip malls so the area is certainly nothing super special.
reviews.title: A generic hotel near USF

reviews.text: Great staff always helpful and going out of their way to satisfy guests. Shuttle to USF and Busch Gardens was so convienent. Breakfast has good variety and is fresh. We continue to return here every time we visit our student at USF. Keep up the good service.
reviews.title: Great-close to USF and Busch Gardens

reviews.text: Great value for your money. Clean, good breakfast, great service. Need larger TV in lounge.
reviews.title: Tampa on a budget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The desk staff was very friendly and helpful. We used the shuttle service to go to Busch Gardens and were very impressed with the shuttle driver. We were driving to Orlando to Sea World and needed directions. The desk staff provided us with directions that were right on! We enjoyed the hot tub. The only complaint that we have is that the shower had very little water pressure. If we travel to Tampa again, I would definitely stay at the Wingate.
reviews.title: A good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights a week ago, on recommendations here on tripadvisor. Well pleased with the hotel - clean, good staff, easy (early) check-in, and breakfast fine. Handily placed for either Busch Gardens or for travel into Tampa. Good restaurants within 5-10 minutes drive away. Hotel room was large, clean, and well appointed. Nothing negative at all, so would recommend if you are going to Busch Gardens or into the city.
reviews.title: Nice clean hotel in good area

reviews.text: I chose this hotel based on other T/A reviews and feel the need to say; this is THE best chain hotel I've ever been in. ALL the staff are friendly and courteous (Eduardo {the night guy} always had a smile and nice word when i came in). all in all 5 star treatment/ facility @ 3 star prices.
reviews.title: Second home!

reviews.text: Excellent hotel. We came with a small group and were extremely pleased. The hotel is clean and the staff is very curteous. Transportation services to the parks were efficient, and the breakfast was good. Comfortable rooms, good TV channel selection and nice amenities. I will stay here are my next visit to Busch Gardens.
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the best time for the second time visiting this hotel. The management and staff are very professional and freindly, the breakfast is awesome and the pool and hot tub topped it all. We would recommend this hotel to any of our friends and as a matter of fact we intend to revisit Florida in the near future and if in the same area we will stay here again. Check in and out was very smooth.
reviews.title: vacation

reviews.text: Cindy & Ron Jenkins
reviews.title: Convenient location to attractions

reviews.text: We stayed here 2 nts. to visit Busch Gardens. Friendly and helpful staff. Great location and excellent shuttle service available for Busch Gardens and USF. Room was a little musty, and not up to my cleaning standards, but issues were minor. Room had a musty smell that bothered us some. Beds were very comfy, and mattresses were new. Pillows were awful - small and flat, very uncomfortable. Hotel was quiet, and we enjoyed the outdoor pool and indoor hot tub area. Breakfast was okay. There were some hot items available - eggs and sausage. Also waffle makers - but waffles were pasty tasting. I usually love the waffles but this was not good. Maybe batter was not prepared properly? The rest was typical hotel continental breakfast items. Nothing special.
reviews.title: Great value, and nice room

reviews.text: We stayed over a Sunday and Monday night. Hotel was not crowded, and we had a decent stay. Not sure if I would choose this place again, but it was adequate for a short stay.
reviews.title: Clean rooms and great hot breakfast

reviews.text: Our kids loved the pool and they had a nice jacuzzi for us. The sleeper sofa and beds were very comfortable. It was the perfect place to rest after a long day at Busch Gardens. Staff was very courteous to us. We were able to print out tickets quickly in their business center — another plus.
reviews.title: Second Stay at the Wyndham

reviews.text: This hotel is just minutes away from Busch Gardens and the shuttle service is awesome. The rooms are very nice and clean. The front desk staff is very friendly as well as the hotel manager. The breakfast buffet was very good.
reviews.title: A great home away from home.

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our visit to Wingate by Wyndam. The facilities were very clean and the staff was exceptionally nice. The only thing i was not too happy about was that there was no wi fi in my room at all. The people at the front desk tried to help and even had the internet services provider call me but to no avail. I would just come to the lobby to browse the internet. Other than that, it was a great experience. My daughter was esecially happy that when we would come in for a long day playing, her stuffed animals were arranged on the bed neatly as if they were waiting for her to come home. Special thanks to Diego and Manuel. Very nice people!!!!!
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay when Enjoying Busch Gardens

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights mainly because it was so close to Busch Gardens. I used the free shuttle bus service that runs every 30 mins. To get brought back you have to call the hotel first to let them know. I had no phone but customer services at Busch Gardens will call for you if you ask.
reviews.title: A good find

reviews.text: Having moved from a poor hotel in the Orlando area before arriving here this place was a breath of fresh air. Although budget in price it was clean, airy and spacious with a friendly and efficient welcome from the manager. The room again was clean and everything about the hotel looked new. The free breakfast was fresh and prepared in small quantities. I noticed kitchen staff coming out constantly to resupply stocks, so it was always warm and fresh. The pool was well used and we made use of the hot tub. There are also plenty of restaurants in the area and the hotel provides a map so finding them is easy. I couldn't have asked for more from the hotel and would return if in the area again. If you find somewhere that is right there's no need to look any further. I was told before arriving that the area around Busch Gardens is the roughest area of Tampa but this hotel is oppsoite the USF university campus and feels safe.
reviews.title: A very good option

reviews.text: I have not stayed at a Wingate hotel before, so I was unsure what to expect. I was nicely surprised by the facilities. I had just come from a 'fancy' Walt Disney World property where I had been quite disappointed, so I wasn't expecting much here. My room was clean, the facility was quiet, and the breakfast was pretty good. The only problem I had was that it was a little diffucult to figure out which driveway was for the facility when I first drove up. All the personnel were very friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: Hotel Stay

reviews.text: We were so impressed with our stay. We arrived late in the evening and the hotel was noticeably clean from the lobby all the way up to our room. The room was spotless,spacious and very comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was excellent. It had everything a family with small children could want...and more!
reviews.title: Jody and April Foster. We didn't want to leave.

reviews.text: The manager, Manuel Aguiar was walking around talking to hotel guests, making sure everyone was comfortable and that their needs were being met. He personally introduced us to his front desk staff, which made us feel even more welcome. The shuttle service to the park was great. It saved us parking fees at Busch Gardens and the van ride was made comfortable and entertaining by our driver. I will definitely stay at this hotel whenever I am in the Tampa area.
reviews.title: Excellent service.

aka: Wingate By Wyndham Tampa Usf / Busch Gardens Hotel
description: Wingate by Wyndham Tampa is located directly across the street from University of South Florida and less than a mile away from Busch Gardens and Adventure Island. The USF Sun Dome, MOSI Imax/Museum, VA, Shriner's and Moffitt are all within .75 miles. Within 2 miles are shopping, golf, and 40-plus restaurants and the property is only 7.5 miles from downtown Tampa, 11 miles from Ybor City and Channelside entertainment district, 17 miles to airport, and 45 minutes from Clearwater Beach and Ellenton Prime Outlets. Awarded Customer Service honors by Wyndham Worldwide, and Green Lodging Certification by the State of Florida DEP, the Wingate by Wyndham Tampa strives for the highest standards for their leisure and corporate travelers alike. Property Highlights Include- Local Shuttle Service (with our most popular destinations free to our guests)within a three mile radius, complimentary 40-item Hot breakfast, free Hi-Speed wired and wireless internet throughout, complimentary business center, fitness room, and indoor whirlpool open 24 ours, and an outdoor pool open until 10pm. New Lounge, built in July 2009, serves wine and beer on tap nightly. Meeting room facilities on property. Room Highlights - All 86 guestrooms at Wingate by Wyndham Tampa offer complimentary wired and wireless high-speed Internet access, micro fridge units, pillow-top mattresses, one cordless and one 2-Line phone, complimentary weekday newspaper, cable television with HBO, pay-per-view Movies and Nintendo, iron and ironing board, hair dryers, and 17" in-room safes. The January, 2009 property renovation included all new guestroom furniture, 32 inch Flat-Panel Televisions, new microwave/refrigerator units, all new fixtures and granite countertops in guestroom bathrooms, Sealy Posturepedic pillow top mattresses, new bedding and 250-thread-count cotton sheets.
